meanings.sent1: The abolisher made sure to remove all the old rules.
meanings.sent2: The abolisher of slavery fought for freedom for all.
meanings.sent3: The abolisher decided to ban all homework, much to the delight of students.
meanings.sent4: She was like an abolisher of darkness, bringing light to every corner.
meanings.sent5: The abolisher's determination to erase injustice was unwavering.

meanings.definition: The act of abolishing or putting an end to something.
meanings.sent1: The abolisher of the law was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent2: The abolisher of the outdated tradition was celebrated by the community.
meanings.sent3: The abolisher of bedtime was a mischievous child who loved staying up late.
meanings.sent4: The abolisher of silence filled the room with laughter and chatter.
meanings.sent5: The abolisher's impact on history was profound and lasting.
